content.description: This is the slab route that is just to the right of Derailment.   The crux is slabby in nature and requires a delicate move to climbers left.  A few more friction moves will get one to an interesting overhanging finish move.
content.protection: 5 bolts + 2 bolt top achor and rap links.
content.location: This route is two routes to the right of the bolted black streaked water grove.  The start is just to the left (western) edge of the 3 log "benches".

content.description: Scramble up on the small perch on the left most (western) end on the 1880 East Formation.  Follow the bolts over multiple bulges. A 70 meter rope will suffice for the rappel.  A 60 meter with be short unless using two.
content.protection: Bolts with a two bolt rap achor with chains.
content.location: Left most bolted line on the 1880 East Formation.  The starting perch is to the left of the small attached pillar.

content.description: Climb the low angled slab up to the horizontal and steeper bolt line. Cruz move is moving over the second horizontal.
content.location: Forty feet right of the landmark, refrigerator sized boulder on the west end of the wall.

content.description: Climb golden yellow streak to the top. Gold Spike visible near the second bolt in Horizontal.
content.location: Sixty Feet right of the landmark, refrigerator sized block on the west end of the wall.

content.description: The crux is at the first few bolts.  Follow the upper trough to the achors.
content.protection: 5 bolts with a 2 bolt anchor and chains.
content.location: This route is the right most bolted line on the wall

content.description: The route has an old school first bolt followed by a piton in the horizontal crack.   Newer bolts finish the route out.  Fun right  palm push at the first new bolt at the start of the tough.  Palm and stem the upper trough to the achors.
content.protection: 5 bolts and one piton (second protection point), two bolts and chains at the top.
content.location: Walk east (right when looking at the wall) past the three log "benches" and slightly down hill for about 50 feet.  This route is the second bolted line from the right.   Look for the old angle iron style first bolt.

content.description:
At the white discoloration at the base of the route, climb the low-angled slab pst the horizontal and up to the first bolt. Follow the bolts to the anchors.  

  (Dec. 2014 large chock stone at the Horizontal was very loose. Be Careful)
content.protection: 5 Bolts. Nice Anchors at the top
content.location: Twenty-five feet of the large Landmark, refrigerator-sized block on the west end of the wall. Located about 15feet east of Choo Choo.

content.description: Climb the lower slab, past the initial bulge, up the steep face, and then over the crux at the second bulge.   The crux is at the bolt 5.
content.protection: 7 Bolts and 2 bolt top anchor with a single welded rap ring.
content.location: This route starts at the in the area with the 3 log "benches". The start is close to the middle "bench" and is two routes to the left of the route with the gold  rail road spike.

content.description: Climb the bolt line left of the yellow streak.
content.location: Fifty feet right of the landmark, refrigerator sized block on the west end of the wall.

content.description: Climb the black water streak between two major dikes. Simple moves to the top. Tricky high knee move between 2-3 bolt.
content.protection: 5 quick draws. nice anchors at the top.  This route can be top roped with some minimal scrambling around to the top of 1880 east. Anchor from Top rope is tricky to get to.
content.location: Fifteen feet east of the landmark, refrigerator sized block on the W end of the wall.

content.description: The is the Eastern most rock along the road. It is kitty corner to the sharp curve in the road. All routes are accessible for TR, all routes face S.   This is a great spot to climb when the weather is cooler as it gets sun all day long.
